tool_description: Manages access control and permissions for files, handling user authentication, authorization levels, and permission inheritance.

file_id.description: Unique identifier of the file for permission management

user_id.description: User requesting access or having permissions modified

operation.description: Permission operation: grant, revoke, check, or list

permission_level.description: Permission level: read, write, delete, or admin

group_permissions.description: List of group IDs to apply permissions to

error_messages: File not found: The specified file_id does not correspond to an existing file.
Invalid user: The user_id does not correspond to a valid user in the system.
Invalid operation: Operation must be one of grant, revoke, check, or list.
Invalid permission level: Permission level must be read, write, delete, or admin.
Insufficient privileges: Current user lacks authority to modify permissions for this file.
Group not found: One or more group IDs in group_permissions do not exist.
usage: Provide file_id, user_id, and operation as required parameters. For grant/revoke operations, specify permission_level. Use group_permissions to apply permissions to multiple users simultaneously.

operation_result.description: Result of the permission operation: success, failed, or partial

current_permissions.description: Current permission levels for the user

effective_permissions.description: Effective permissions including inherited group permissions

permission_source.description: Source of permissions: direct, group, or inherited
